thread.title: Kong Disneyland building evacuated after suspect package found
thread.title_full: Hong Kong Disneyland building evacuated after suspect package found | South China Morning Post

author: Clifford Lo
title: Kong Disneyland building evacuated after suspect package found
text:
The main office building at Hong Kong Disneyland was evacuated of at least 100 workers on Monday afternoon after a parcel addressed to a senior executive was suspected of containing wires and a battery.
A source said the Lantau Island park’s sniffer dog indicated the parcel contained dangerous goods, and staff called police.
Police bomb disposal experts headed to the park’s administration building on Magic Road at about 12.45pm.
“Police were told that the parcel was found to have carried suspected wires and battery during an X-ray inspection,” the source said.
Shanghai Disney riding high and on track to overtake Hong Kong ‘rival’ 
“The park’s sniffer dog was also deployed to detect any dangerous goods, and gave a positive indication.”
He said the building was sealed off as officers investigated.
It was understood at least 100 workers were cleared from the building. The theme park, and its visitors, were not affected.
A police spokeswoman said a male park worker complained of feeling unwell while leaving the building. He was taken to North Lantau Hospital, near Tung Chung.
The spokeswoman said officers were still investigating at the scene at mid-afternoon.
A Disneyland spokeswoman confirmed workers had been cleared from the building after a suspicious object was found.
